c74object.name: abc.hoa.map~
c74object.description:
abc.hoa.map~ enables you to encode multiple sources in ambisonic in polar coordinates. In contrary to the abc.hoa.encoder~, the user can change the distance between the sweet-spot and the source.
Each input of this object corresponds to a multichannel signal which combines the signal source and its polar coordinates [sig, radian, meter].
For example, if the user spatializes 2 sources (e.g. using @sources 2), the object will have 2 inputs. The first input will expects a 3 channels mc signal corresponding to the signal of the first source and its polar coordinates. The second input will expects a 3 channels mc signal corresponding to the signal of the second source and its polar coordinates.

inlet.description: signal and its polar coordinates [sig, radian, meter]

objarg.name: ambisonic-order
objarg.description: first argument is the ambisonic order [init=1:min=1:max=7:step=1].
